Client-Side Caching

The HTTP/1.1 Cache-Control response header is configurable via the cache.client.* keys in the configuration file. To enable or disable it, use the cache.client.enabled key:

The default settings look something like this:

These are reasonable defaults that tell clients they can keep cached images for one month (2592000 seconds).

Note: the Cache-Control header must have a particular structure, so not just any combination of the above will work. See this brief overview, for example.
